books.title: Salem Chapel
books.author: Margaret Oliphant
books.summary: A young dissenting minister experiences challenges to his pastorate while going through personal crises.

books.title: Lord Tony’s Wife
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A young woman and her father are kidnapped by a man intent on revenge for his father’s death.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Othello
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Jealousy destroys the marriage between an older black man and a younger white woman in 1500s Venice.

books.title: Lady Into Fox
books.author: David Garnett
books.summary: A newly married young woman is suddenly transformed into a fox, to the consternation and enduring grief of her husband.

books.title: The Just Men of Cordova
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men travel to Spain to bring justice to criminals operating in aristocratic high finance.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A Strange Disappearance
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A young detective is challenged to find a missing woman in New York City.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: Mutual Aid
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: Kropotkin explores the role of cooperation in animal societies and human societies, past and present, and how it could benefit modern society.

books.title: Metamorphoses
books.author: Ovid
books.summary: A collection of Greek and Roman myths that involve various forms of transformation.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A collection of all of the short stories and novellas written by Leo Tolstoy.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
